member.name: T:Inide.WebServices.Infrastructure.Helpers.StringHelper
member.summary: This static class contains some helper functions that operate on objects.

member.name: M:Inide.WebServices.Infrastructure.Helpers.StringHelper.IsEmptyOrNull(System.String)

summary.p: Returns true if is null or empty (zero length)

remarks.p: This function might be useful if an empty string is assumed to be null.
This is an extension method, so it can be called directly as str.IsNullOrEmpty().

member.returns: If is null or empty, true

member.name: M:Inide.WebServices.Infrastructure.Helpers.StringHelper.IsNullOrEmpty(System.String)

summary.p: Returns true if is null or empty (zero length)

remarks.p: This function might be useful if an empty string is assumed to be null.
This is an extension method, so it can be called directly as str.IsNullOrEmpty().

member.returns: If is null or empty, true

member.name: M:Inide.WebServices.Infrastructure.Helpers.StringHelper.IsTrimmedEmpty(System.String)
member.summary: Checks if a string is null, empty or just contains whitespace characters.

remarks.p: Warning: "\n" (line end), "\t" (tab) and some other are also considered as whitespace). To see a list see function.
This is an extension method, so it can be called directly as str.IsTrimmedEmpty().

member.returns: If string is null, empty or contains only white space, true

member.name: M:Inide.WebServices.Infrastructure.Helpers.StringHelper.TrimToNull(System.String)

summary.p: Removes whitespace characters in the left or right of the string, and if resulting string is empty or null, returns null.

remarks.p: Generally, when a user entered string is going to be saved to database, if user entered an empty string, null or a string of whitespaces, it is stored as null, otherwise it is expected to remove whitespace at start and end only.
Warning: "\n" (line end), "\t" (tab) and some other are also considered as whitespace). To see a list see function.
This is an extension method, so it can be called directly as str.TrimToNull().

member.returns: Trimmed string, result is null if empty.

summary.p: Removes whitespace characters in the left or right of the string, and if resulting string is empty or null, returns empty.

remarks.p: Generally, when a user entered string is going to be saved to database, if user entered an empty string, null or a string of whitespaces, it is stored as empty string, otherwise it is expected to remove whitespace at start and end only.
Warning: "\n" (line end), "\t" (tab) and some other are also considered as whitespace). To see a list see function.
This is an extension method, so it can be called directly as str.TrimToEmpty().

member.name: M:Inide.WebServices.Infrastructure.Helpers.StringHelper.IsTrimmedSame(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Compares two strings ignoring whitespace at the left or right.

remarks.p: null is considered to be empty.
Warning: "\n" (line end), "\t" (tab) and some other are also considered as whitespace). To see a list see function.
This function can be used to compare a string entered by user to the value in the database for equality.

member.returns: If two strings are same trimmed, true

member.name: M:Inide.WebServices.Infrastructure.Helpers.StringHelper.ThreeDots(System.String,System.Int32)
member.summary: If the string's length is over a specified limit, trims its right and adds three points ("...").
member.remarks: This is an extension method, so it can be called directly as str.ThreeDots().
member.param: Maksimum length for the resulting string. If given as 0, or is shorter than this value, string returns as is. Otherwise it is trimmed to be under this limit in length including "the three dots".
member.returns: itself, or trimmed and three dotted string
